metadata.title: CVE-2020-10700 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
A use-after-free flaw was found in the way samba AD DC LDAP servers,handled 'Paged Results' control is combined with the 'ASQ' control. Amalicious user in a samba AD could use this flaw to cause denial ofservice. This issue affects all samba versions before 4.10.15, before4.11.8 and before 4.12.2.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-10700` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ctdb - 2:4.11.6+dfsg-0ubuntu1.1
libnss-winbind - 2:4.11.6+dfsg-0ubuntu1.1
libpam-winbind - 2:4.11.6+dfsg-0ubuntu1.1
libsmbclient - 2:4.11.6+dfsg-0ubuntu1.1
libwbclient0 - 2:4.11.6+dfsg-0ubuntu1.1
python3-samba - 2:4.11.6+dfsg-0ubuntu1.1
registry-tools - 2:4.11.6+dfsg-0ubuntu1.1
samba - 2:4.11.6+dfsg-0ubuntu1.1
samba-common - 2:4.11.6+dfsg-0ubuntu1.1
samba-common-bin - 2:4.11.6+dfsg-0ubuntu1.1
samba-dsdb-modules - 2:4.11.6+dfsg-0ubuntu1.1
samba-libs - 2:4.11.6+dfsg-0ubuntu1.1
samba-testsuite - 2:4.11.6+dfsg-0ubuntu1.1
samba-vfs-modules - 2:4.11.6+dfsg-0ubuntu1.1
smbclient - 2:4.11.6+dfsg-0ubuntu1.1
winbind - 2:4.11.6+dfsg-0ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: samba package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:4.11.6+dfsg-0ubuntu1.1').
